dialog.text: Hi there. The seeker  is looking for someone to share a moment from past. The supporter could tell the seeker to write down a feeling or feeling. The supporter could also ask the seeker to think of something that she or he loves about herself.
Oh, hello. How are you doing?

I'm not feeling weel. The seeker  is not feeling weel. The support could provide different things to help the seeker feel better. The supporter could say something like "I am so sorry that you are feeling weel. I can help you in any way that I can."
Oh, I feel bad to hear that. What is the matter?

I lost my job recently and didn't have luck finding a new one. That's really making me stressful. I don't know what to do... The seeker  feels stressed and worried about her job situation. The supporter could help the seeker to know what the issue is and to find resources. The supporter could also say the seeker should reach out to her friends or colleagues to get support.
I am so sorry to hear that. I can understand how frustrating that can be, especially when you have been working hard to get back on your feet.
beam_texts: I am so sorry to hear that. I can understand how frustrating that can be, especially when you have been working hard to get back on your feet.

dialog.text: I've been looking for a job for months and I just can't find one. I don't know what to do. The seeker  feels stressed and knows that she has lost her job. The supporter could say that the seeker has not been looking for a job in a while and that something has finally happened to take her down.
Have you tried looking online? I know that I have found many jobs online.
beam_texts: Have you tried looking online? I know that I have found many jobs online.

dialog.text: I have, but I'm not sure what to do to make myself look good on the application. The seeker  feels overwhelmed and lost. The supporter could provide more information about the seeker's situation and could also offer support.
I would suggest putting on your resume that you have been looking for a job for a while and that this is how you found it.
beam_texts: I would suggest putting on your resume that you have been looking for a job for a while and that this is how you found it.

dialog.text: That's a good idea. But, I feel like I should have more experience than I do. The seeker  feels overwhelmed and lost because she has not found a job in a long time. The supporter could help the seeker to find job postings or online resources.
I know that there are a lot of jobs out there but you have to be persistent and put in applications everywhere.
beam_texts: I know that there are a lot of jobs out there but you have to be persistent and put in applications everywhere.

dialog.text: That's true. I guess I need to keep trying. Do you have any suggestions on how to be more persistent? The seeker  feels overwhelmed and lost for ideas. The supporter could provide some solutions for the seeker to keep trying.
Have you tried reaching out to hiring agencies for help with a resume and/or a job interview?
beam_texts: Have you tried reaching out to hiring agencies for help with a resume and/or a job interview?

dialog.text: I have tried reaching out for help. I think I need to try again. What should I say to them? The seeker  feels trysted and able to try again. The supporter could provide more resources for the seeker in terms of receptionist or hiring agency.

I would suggest what you said in your post:  "I've been applying for jobs for almost a year now and I haven't gotten a single call back. I feel like I'm going crazy."  And tell them the details of what is going on.  They will probably want to know about any work experience you have, how long you've been looking, and if you have any connections that might help.  Also, if you have a family, they might want to know if you are being treated unfairly or if there is something wrong with the job market in your area.
beam_texts: I would suggest what you said in your post:  "I've been applying for jobs for almost a year now and I haven't gotten a single call back. I feel like I'm going crazy."  And tell them the details of what is going on.  They will probably want to know about any work experience you have, how long you've been looking, and if you have any connections that might help.  Also, if you have a family, they might want to know if you are being treated unfairly or if there is something wrong with the job market in your area.

dialog.text: I feel like I'm going crazy! The seeker  feels lost and SCARED of what to do. The supporter could tell her that she needs to get back to work and try to find a new job.

I think that it is a perfectly normal reaction to have to feeling lost in a new situation.  And it sounds like your family is supportive, so if you have a problem, they should be there to help you through it.
beam_texts: I think that it is a perfectly normal reaction to have to feeling lost in a new situation.  And it sounds like your family is supportive, so if you have a problem, they should be there to help you through it.

dialog.text: I just feel so discouraged.  I'm going to keep trying.  I just have to keep my head up. The seeker  feels discouraged and does not know what to do. The supporter could tell her to try and feel better before she continues struggling.
I think that is a good approach.  I think you will find that a lot of your friends are in the same situation.
beam_texts: I think that is a good approach.  I think you will find that a lot of your friends are in the same situation.

dialog.text: I think you're right.  My friends seem to be having a much easier time than I am.  I don't know what I'm doing wrong.  I think I'm just too hard on myself. The seeker  is feeling discouraged because she does not think she is doing well in her job search. The supporter couldPoint out any problems that the seeker might have and suggest she speak to a professional therapist.

I have been in a similar situation and I know how hard it is to watch your friends get a chance that you don't get.  I think that you should be hard on yourself if you haven't been able to get a job in this economy.
beam_texts: I have been in a similar situation and I know how hard it is to watch your friends get a chance that you don't get.  I think that you should be hard on yourself if you haven't been able to get a job in this economy.

dialog.text: I know, it's so hard to watch.  And then to feel so helpless to change anything. The seeker  feels overwhelmed and helpless. The supporter could provide some support to the seeker by telling her that she may be feeling that way because she is a seeker and is struggling to find a way to get over the fear of not being able to find a job. The supporter could also tell her to try to get more information about her chosen job.
I know that I'm not the only one who is feeling this way.  I think that a lot of people are in a similar situation and that is why there are so many job centers around.
beam_texts: I know that I'm not the only one who is feeling this way.  I think that a lot of people are in a similar situation and that is why there are so many job centers around.

dialog.text: I wish I knew how to find a job in this economy.  I've been so worried about my friends that I haven't looked for myself. The seeker  feels overwhelmed and hopeless because she doesn't know how to find a job. The supporter could help the seeker by providing more resources, like job postings or online job opportunities.
Have you tried looking online?  I know that I have found a lot of job opportunities on LinkedIn and other job sites.
beam_texts: Have you tried looking online?  I know that I have found a lot of job opportunities on LinkedIn and other job sites.

dialog.text: I have tried LinkedIn.  I've sent out a few resumes.  I've gotten a few interviews, but when it comes down to it, they choose someone else. The seeker  is trying to find a job and does not feel confident. The supporter could help the seeker by providing instructions on how to find and apply for jobs.
I know that it is very difficult right now with the pandemic and everything, but I know that you will find a job soon.
beam_texts: I know that it is very difficult right now with the pandemic and everything, but I know that you will find a job soon.

dialog.text: I really hope so.  I'm getting really tired of the unemployment office.  I've been going there every week, and it's just so stressful. The seeker  is struggling to find a job and is scared of the unemployment office. The supporter could tell the seeker to try for a job at a more accessible location.
Have you tried looking online? I know that I found several jobs on indeed.
beam_texts: Have you tried looking online? I know that I found several jobs on indeed.

dialog.text: I've tried Indeed, but it's so competitive there.  I don't know that I've ever gotten an interview there. The seeker  is trying to find a job, but is feeling frustrated because she has not found anything. The supporter should help the seeker by telling her about job search tips or finding a job online.
I understand that it can be very frustrating when you see so many openings and you are not able to get an interview. Have you tried reaching out to hiring agencies to see if they can help you?
beam_texts: I understand that it can be very frustrating when you see so many openings and you are not able to get an interview. Have you tried reaching out to hiring agencies to see if they can help you?

dialog.text: I haven't tried hiring agencies.  That's a good idea. The seeker  feels hopeless and frustrated because she doesn't know how to find a job. The supporter could help her by telling her about a job center or hiring agency that she knows.

I understand that many companies have been switching to hiring agencies because they can find people better than they can on their own. I know that it has been very frustrating for me as well, as I have been looking for a job for almost a year now.
beam_texts: I understand that many companies have been switching to hiring agencies because they can find people better than they can on their own. I know that it has been very frustrating for me as well, as I have been looking for a job for almost a year now.

dialog.text: I wish I could get a job.  I've been trying for months too.  I just don't know what I'm doing wrong. The seeker  feels lost and frustrated because she doesn't know how to find a job. The supporter could provide guidance for the seeker on how to find a job.
Have you tried updating your resume and putting it on job boards? I have found that that is a great way to find jobs!
beam_texts: Have you tried updating your resume and putting it on job boards? I have found that that is a great way to find jobs!

dialog.text: I've tried putting my resume on job boards.  I don't think I've ever put my resume on a job board.  I'll have to try that. The seeker  is trying to find a job but is not sure how to make herself look good on a resume. The supporter could provide more information about what she is trying to do.
I would definitely try that. I know it can be hard to put in so much effort and not have any results, but I know you can get through this!
beam_texts: I would definitely try that. I know it can be hard to put in so much effort and not have any results, but I know you can get through this!

dialog.text: I just don't know what I'm doing wrong.  I'm probably putting too much effort into it and not putting enough effort into the actual application. The seeker  feels like she is struggling with trying to find a job. The supporter could help the seeker by providing more resources such as advice on how to update and improve the application.

I know that I was very hesitant to put my resume out there because I was so worried about not having a job. I was very nervous about not having a job because I loved my job and didn't want to lose it..
beam_texts: I know that I was very hesitant to put my resume out there because I was so worried about not having a job. I was very nervous about not having a job because I loved my job and didn't want to lose it..

dialog.text: I think that's probably what's happening.  I love my job.  I think I'm going to have to find a new place to work. The seeker  feels overwhelmed and lost because she doesn't know what to do with her hands. The supporter could help her by telling her about different job opportunities and how to find them.
I'm sure you'll find something very quickly.
beam_texts: I'm sure you'll find something very quickly.

dialog.text: I'm going to try and keep my head up and keep applying.  I'll keep my fingers crossed! The seeker  is trying to get a job and is frustrated because it's very difficult to find a job. The supporter could help the seeker to update their resume and/or try and find job boards.
I know it is difficult, but I know you will find something soon.
beam_texts: I know it is difficult, but I know you will find something soon.

dialog.text: Thanks for the encouragement! The seeker  is looking for support because he/she is struggling with a problem. The supporter could encourage the seeker to keep trying and that if there are no results in a while, they may need professional help.
You're welcome! I know you will find something soon.
beam_texts: You're welcome! I know you will find something soon.

dialog.text: Thanks!  Have a great day! The seeker  is very frustrated with herself because she feels unable to find a job. The supporter could encourage the seeker to update her resume and look for job board options.
You too!
beam_texts: You too!

You're welcome!

You're welcome!

Have you tried looking online?
